Title: Nollywood actor Odunlade Adekola loses dad
Summary: Popular Nollywood actor Odunlade Adekola has lost his father, Pastor N.A.Adekola . The movie star made this known on Saturday, July 26, through his verified Instagram page . The actor shared a photo of his late father on Instagram .

Title: AL, NDPC, ministry to stop digital rights violations of youth, activists, journalists
Summary: Accountability Lab Nigeria has begun collaborating with the Nigerian Data Protection Commission (NDPC) and the Ministry of Youth Development . AL, NDPC, ministry to stop digital rights violations of youth, activists, journalists .

Title: CIPMN boss urges ethical journalism, strategic project thinking in Nigeria
Summary: The Registrar-General and Chief Executive Officer of the Chartered Institute of Project Managers of Nigeria (CIPMN), Mr. Henry Mbadiwe, urges ethical journalism, strategic project thinking in Nigeria .

Title: 2027: ADC coalition meets in Abuja, rallies North against Tinubu
Summary: The coalition led by the African Democratic Congress (ADC) has intensified the quest to rally the citizenry in the Northern part of the country . It is part of ongoing strategies aimed at unseating the President Bola Tinubu .

Title: Akpabio, Abbas urge leaders to bridge divide, promote unity
Summary: Akpabio, Abbas urge leaders to bridge divide, promote unity . Prominent Nigerian politicians have called for unity and peace among leaders with different political inclinations .

Title: FIFA opens major Africa office in Rabat
Summary: FIFA opens its major Africa office in the Moroccan capital, Rabat . FIFA confirms the North African country as the hub of its operation on the continent .

Title: 2027: Why serving Govs are not joining us yet – ADC
Summary: Coalition-backed African Democratic Congress said the fact that it does not have serving governors in its fold does not detract from its formidability . The party reiterated its determination to send the President Bola Tinubu administration packing .

Title: ‘Keep watching over us’; late Junior Pope’s wife marks 11th wedding anniversary
Summary: Jennifer Odonwodo, wife of late Nollywood actor, Junior Pope Odon wodo, marks 11th wedding anniversary . Jennifer penned an emotional tribute as she marked what would have been their 11th anniversary .

Title: 2027: Jonathan, not Obi is North’s best choice  —  PDP chieftain
Summary: By law, by law, Jonathan’s presidency cannot exceed a four-year tenure, says PDP chieftain . He argues that Obi’�s promise to spend four years in power is merely “political talk”

Title: Kwankwaso’s mischief won’t give him Buhari’s 12m votes – Umahi
Summary: Minister of Works, Engr. David Umahi said Rabiu Kwankwaso's attempt to deceive northerners was not only false but mischievous . He said the former Kano State Governor's claim that President Bola Tinubu’s development projects favours only the South was false .

Title: 2027: Northern consultative forum has adopted ADC – Babachir Lawal
Summary: The National Political Consultative Group (North) has embraced the African Democratic Congress as its preferred opposition platform to challenge the ruling All Progressives Congress in the 2027 elections . Lawal, an ADC chieftain, said Northerners are determined to elect a leader that caters for their interests .

Title: You can’t rename a legacy,' Charly Boy faults renaming of Lagos bus stop
Summary: Charles Oputa has reacted to the renaming of the popular Charly Boy Bus Stop in Lagos . The bus stop, located along the Gbagada–Bariga axis, has been renamed “Baddo Bus Stop” in honour of rapper Olamide Adedeji, also known as Baddo .

Title: Speeding truck crushes woman to death in Lagos
Summary: A woman crushed to death on Friday at Ita Oluwo, a boundary community between Lagos and Ogun states, after a speeding truck with failed brakes rammed into another truck, trapping her between the two . The Lagos State Traffic Management Authority confirmed the crash in a statement signed by the Director, Public Affairs and Enlightenment Department

Title: VIDEO : London Mayor Thanks Nigerians, Ghanaians, S’Africans for Warm Reception During Historic Visit
Summary: The Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan has expressed heartfelt appreciation to the people of Nigeria, Ghana, and South Africa following his recent visit to the three African nations . In a post shared via his official X( formely Twitter) handle on Saturday, Khan thanked citizens for the warm hospitality extended to him, describing the experience as deeply

Title: Fear of intimidation keeps govs from joining ADC coalition - Abdullahi
Summary: The African Democratic Congress has revealed that state governors are hesitant to join the opposition coalition platform formed to challenge President Bola Tinubu due to alleged intimidation . The ADC’s interim National Publicity Secretary, Bolaji Abdullahi, made this known on Saturday during the 3rd Expanded Meeting of the National Political Consultative Group (
